page.title: 01Newquay-An Introduction
page.content:
Newquay is a coastal town situated on a peninsula close to the estuary of the River Gannel.Originally the town developed around the harbour but due to the influence of the tourist trade the town has expanded in a linear pattern along the main east-west axis for about three miles.
The population of the town is approximately 15,600 permanent residents.During the season,however, this figure is boosted by holiday makers to about 100,000.Consequently, the services of the town are aimed at that figure.There is a large fire station with four mobiles and a district police station with well over 100 officers in the summer months.Bus, rail and coach services,extensive in the summer,are reduced to skeleton schedules in the winter.
